waypoints.title: W51-IRS2 Wavelength Explorer
waypoints.description: Use the wavelength slider below to smoothly transition between different infrared wavelengths and explore how W51-IRS2 appears across the spectrum. This massive young stellar object reveals different features at different wavelengths: shorter wavelengths (140-210 nm) show scattered starlight and cooler dust, while longer wavelengths (335-480 nm) trace warmer dust and reveal emission from polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons (PAHs). Slide from short to long wavelengths to see the changing view!

wavelengths.label: RGB: 1.82μm / 1.62μm / 1.40μm
wavelengths.description: Near-infrared view (1.4-1.8 μm) showing scattered starlight from the central young stellar object and cooler dust in the surrounding envelope. These shorter wavelengths penetrate through some of the dust, revealing the structure close to the star.

wavelengths.label: RGB: 1.62μm / 2.10μm / 1.87μm
wavelengths.description: Short near-infrared view (1.6-2.1 μm) capturing H₂ emission at 2.1 μm (green) and stellar scattered light. The H₂ emission traces shocked gas in outflows and the photodissociation region around the massive young star.

wavelengths.label: RGB: 4.80μm / 4.05μm / 1.87μm
wavelengths.description: Wide wavelength range (1.9-4.8 μm) showing the transition from stellar light (blue) to warm dust and PAH emission (red). The long-wavelength emission reveals the warmest dust heated by the embedded massive star.

wavelengths.label: RGB: 3.60μm / 3.35μm / 2.10μm
wavelengths.description: Mid-infrared view (2.1-3.6 μm) where warm dust emission dominates. The 3.3 μm PAH feature (green) traces complex organic molecules in the photodissociation region, while continuum emission shows warm dust heated by the central source.

wavelengths.label: RGB: 4.05μm / 3.60μm / 3.35μm
wavelengths.description: Mid-infrared (3.3-4.1 μm) dominated by PAH emission features at 3.3 μm and warm dust continuum. These wavelengths reveal the interaction between the intense radiation field and surrounding material, showing complex organic chemistry.

wavelengths.label: RGB: 4.80μm / 4.10μm / 4.05μm
wavelengths.description: Long-wavelength mid-infrared (4.1-4.8 μm) showing the warmest dust emission and Brα hydrogen recombination line at 4.05 μm (blue). This view traces the ionized gas and hottest dust closest to the massive young stellar object.
